You can create an MassIndex indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the MassIndex constructor.

MassIndex()1/1

            MassIndex QuantConnect.Indicators.MassIndex (
    *string                       name,
    *Int32                       emaPeriod,
    *Int32                       sumPeriod,
   )

Creates a new Mass Index indicator. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose Mass Index we want.
*Int32 emaPeriod (Optional) The period used by both EMA.
*Int32 sumPeriod (Optional) The sum period.

Return

MassIndex - The Mass Index indicator for the requested name over the specified period

Definition at file Indicators/MassIndex.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private MassIndex _mass;

// In Initialize()
_mass = new MassIndex();
_mass.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _mass, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_mass.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _mass.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.mass = MassIndex()
self.mass.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.mass, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.mass.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.mass.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private MassIndex _mass;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_mass = new MassIndex();
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _mass.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_mass.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _mass.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.mass = MassIndex()
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.mass.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.mass.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.mass.Current.Value
